comment: Did all of the homework, and did online tutoring. His tests are 5 problems and nothing like you see in the hardest homework problems. Might be ok if you have taken calc before but I would not recommend him at all. Prides himself on being one of the hardest calc teachers.

This guy is not a good teacher. I wouldn't recommend him to anyone until he grows up and becomes a professional individual who takes his job seriously. He is extremely lazy, has no structure in his presentation, and he doesnt hand back assignments in NEARLY a timely fashion...Just not a good professor. Maybe too much going on in his personal life..

Great teacher. Extremely helpful. The semester I took he never took up homework, but it was a disaster bc only I and maybe 4 others did it, so most of the class failed. He's very friendly and willing to go over the material with you during office hours over and over until you understand. It's not difficult, he just expects you to try.
He is really smart and there are a bunch of students who have already taken Calc in high school so he teaches for them but if you havent taken it before I wouldnt recommend him

Took Griffiths for Number Theory, class was extremely easy. Lots of homework, but I don't think I ever spent more than 30 minutes on an assignment. Tests are easy, if you go to class you'll have no problem. Overall it was one of the easiest math classes I've taken.
Again, if you want to learn the subject, take this professor, but, you have to be willing to work your butt off.  Homework is huge.  Gives extra credit - use it.

If you really want to learn the subject, then take this guy.  He definitely knows his stuff and can teach it, but, you have to be willing to spend a lot of time on the course.  Homework is huge in his classes - it will make or break you.  Also gives extra credit ... I suggest you do them all, even if you don't think you need it.

If you need a good grade, steer clear. Your GPA waning, steer clear, not a good one to pair up with tougher courses. Good teacher yes, but it is not unusual for many to repeat his class. Wish I had known.

The teacher was alright. Dear Chubby-Talker guy, if you're reading this please know that it's incredibly annoying when I hear your voice more than I hear the teacher's. I get it, you're smart and know everything. shut up. BTW no one asked what assignments/classes you thought were easy or hard and the teacher didn't ask for your input.

homework: 30 minutes each problem * 12 problems + no calculator = bye bye life. He's actually great at teaching you how to do this stuff, and it's really not that hard. it's just ridiculious how long each problem takes and how many he assigns. Takes awhile to give tests back. If you have a "busy" class schedule I wouldn't recommend this class.

He left just the right amount of homework. He went over the content as many times as needed. He was always available for questions. Respectful with the students. I took the course after 10 years away from math and didn't have any problems to understand the material and to pass.

Horrible teacher, I am almost positive he has left SPSU, probably to torment another college. He has a phd in math, not teaching, and he thinks he is funny so he treats his students however he wants and would discretely offend the class. If I would have known he was a major smoker I would not have taken the class, he reeked everytime he walked in.

I dont know what everyone else is complaining about... i think he is a very good teacher. he expains it over and over as many times as you want. he gets into it also, which is a plus. if u dont want a boring math class, take him
do not take this this teacher you will not get a good grade. you have been warned. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND that you take this with the chinese discrete math teacher.

the materiaal in the book looked easy enough but the homework he gives is insane. and he gives it everyday like 40 super hard problems. so BASICALLY HE TURNED AN OTHERWISE EASY CLASS INTO the hardest class ever. he was a funny guy though

Pretty nice guy, but terrible, terrible teacher.  The points he makes are very unclear and hard to understand.  He grades the homework on a correctness factor which can be frustrating especially since the material was hard to understand.  Over half of the people in my class dropped before the class was even half over.

He rushes and assumes you know a lot of things. His tests are ridiculously hard. He collects homework religiously as if we are in middle school. Cool guy, but not a very good teacher. He knows the stuff, but doesn't deliver it well. Trust me.
Very difficult class. Try to get someone else to teach it to you.

Be prepared for a shock of a journey.  He goes very fast, and its hard to grasp the concepts even if you think you have it.  He gives alot of homework, do it, and you maybe ok, but it will take several hours, and you will have to keep practing.  His test are similar to homework problems, but do the other problems not assigned. Just be prepared.
bad

Griffiths has to be on of the most difficult professors at southern poly. He does not teach the material that well and his test are ungodly hard...all except the final which is quite easy. 3/4 of my class dropped out before half semester i thought i could stick it out. If u are struggling in his class DROP THE CLASS cuz he cares nothing bout effort

Professor made this class much harder than it was suppose to be. He taught the class as a Major course. Even tho hard professor he also made sure u know ur material and MUCH more for the tests. U may feel stupid in his class but when u come out if u pass or not u will know the material u were suppose to learn.

A great teacher: knowledgeable, involved, personable. But if you're weak in math, he's acedemic suicide. He's very much into theory and covers topics at breakneck speed. Homework assignments could take 6 hours, and are collected randomly. Majority of class fails test. I was completely frustrated with this class. Great for math majors, bad for me.
Taught the class like we were children. The class wasn't even college level, it was simply baby-talk.
Breezes through chapter with explanations which are easy to follow but do not stick. Most of actual help was given by TA. Smart guy - maybe even as smart as he thinks he is. Funny.  Nice. Immature.

He grades homework, which sucks. The Tests are incredibly difficult, most people fail them. But his grading scale is wack, an 85 is a A, a 70 is a B. He does this becuase he knows his**** is hard, but he teaches it very well. One test almost everyone failed, and i pulled off a 15/20, and he let us correct our test for 5 extra points. Great teacher

(college algebra) Teaches way too fast and knows way too much about math to understand that this class is supposed to be college level algebra.. Very hard tests, very frequent.  Collects homework when he feels like it. Assigns 100+ problems every day of the week. He's a nice guy but extremely difficult, not lenient.
Really fast if you can keep up. Do th homework and you will do well in the class. Very helpful with meeting with students. Ask questions about the material.
good teacher but goes to fast for me, requires homework and gives partial credit on tests. Nice guy

Teacher is 27 years old, extremely laid back and student oriented.  Has a tendency to go a little fast through his lectures in terms of explaining things, but he is usually detailed in his explanations. No attendance policy.  Tests are so-so, just make sure you study and ask questions as he is eagar to help students.  Overall a very good teacher

he grades the homework extremely hard, and u have to do all of it, which takes at least 2 hours, when u know what your doing. his tests are somewhat difficult, but his homework is what really pisses me off the most.
Great teacher...fun...smart...helpful.
He's a good techer if you like teachers who explain at a fast pace. If you're taking more than his class then this isn't for you. Requires for you to do homework! ENOUGH SAID!!
Very good at what he does, keeps me awake at least, though talks fast and is hard to follow sometimes.

Very cool teacher. You still have to learn the material and do homework but Griffiths has a good sense of humor, he's funny, and he trys his best TO MAKE MATH LESS PAINFUL. Derives almost everything, & leaves plenty of time for questions without letting the class get behind. [currently on part-time]
